page.title: 06 ARMITAGE CHURCH STUDY
page.content: St.John the Baptist Church dates back to 1160.The tower and vestry were built later.The sandstone building has a tile and timber roof. There are two doors and sixteen main stained-glass windows.The church is 100m.long,25m. wide with a 10m.tower. The carved eagle lectern, the pews and the hymn books were from nearby churches which had closed due to a drift in population. The stone pulpit is decorated with carved angels and flowers, the altar with embroidered cloths. Outside are gargoyles and stone crosses.Yew,lilac holly, wild violet,orchids and harebells are found in the churchyard. The rector holds about 5 services a week plus services for weddings, funerals and baptisms. About 70 local families take part in the Youth club Mothers Union, festivals and Concerts.
